back_cards.definition_en: Used to form a negative statement.
back_cards.example_en: I’m not going to the party.
That’s not what I meant.
Do not touch the hot stove.
There’s not enough time today.
It’s not blue, it’s green.
I wanted to go, but I was tired.
Everyone but Tom was there.
It’s not perfect, but it works.
She’s young, but very talented.
I’d help, but I’m too busy.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to multiple people or things.
back_cards.example_en: They went to the park together.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for a group previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: The kids? They’re playing outside.
They say it’s going to rain.
If they call, take a message.
They built a new school nearby.
She says she’ll be here soon.

back_cards.definition_en: To state an opinion or fact.
back_cards.example_en: They say the movie is great.
He said to meet at noon.
The news says it’s snowing.
Her smile says she’s happy.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a specific location or point.
back_cards.example_en: Meet me at the coffee shop.
The show starts at 7 p.m.
She waved at her friend.
Gas is sold at $3 a gallon.
He’s good at solving puzzles.
What time is the meeting?
I don’t know what happened.
What! You got a new car?
What did you say just now?
Tell me what you want to do.
That’s his jacket on the chair.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something belonging to him.
back_cards.example_en: His dog is really friendly.
His smile lights up the room.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in relation to a male.
back_cards.example_en: I borrowed his pen yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows ownership of an idea or action.
back_cards.example_en: That was his idea, not mine.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a starting point or origin.
back_cards.example_en: I’m from Chicago originally.
Take the book from the shelf.
She learned it from her teacher.
We’re open from 9 to 5.
This is different from that one.
Let’s go to the park.
The train goes in ten minutes.
Does your watch still go?
The party went on all night.
This shirt goes with those pants.
Do you want tea or coffee?
Hurry, or we’ll be late.
It’s a fox, or maybe a coyote.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows a consequence of not acting.
back_cards.example_en: Study, or you’ll fail the test.
You can call or text me.
I sent it by email.
The park is by the river.

back_cards.definition_en: Denotes the agent performing an action.
back_cards.example_en: The book was written by her.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a deadline or time.
back_cards.example_en: Finish this by tomorrow.
We’re ahead by two points.
I need to get some groceries.
I don’t get what you mean.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrive or reach a place.
back_cards.example_en: We got to the airport early.

back_cards.definition_en: To become or start to be.
back_cards.example_en: It’s getting cold outside.
She got a gift for her birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a female person previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: She went to the store.
She always helps her friends.
I saw her at the party.
She was the star of the show.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a female in a hypothetical situation.
back_cards.example_en: If she calls, let me know.
This is my favorite book.
My phone is on the table.
My mom makes great cookies.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something associated with the speaker.
back_cards.example_en: My job keeps me busy.
My day was really hectic.
I can swim really well.
You can borrow my book.
It can rain this afternoon.
Can you help me with this?

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to general knowledge or fact.
back_cards.example_en: Anyone can learn to cook.
She’s as tall as her brother.
He works as a teacher.
I stayed home as I was sick.
I waved as she drove by.
Do it as I showed you.
I know the answer to that.

back_cards.definition_en: To be familiar with someone or something.
back_cards.example_en: She knows the city well.
I know how you feel.
You’ll know him by his red hat.
I know this song by heart.
I’ll go if you’re going too.
I wonder if she’ll call.
What if we miss the bus?

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a polite request or suggestion.
back_cards.example_en: If you don’t mind, I’ll leave.
You can join if you’re ready.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker as the object.
back_cards.example_en: She gave me a book.
Tell me what happened.
That song means a lot to me.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker in a situation.
back_cards.example_en: Wait for me at the station.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in reflexive or emphatic cases.
back_cards.example_en: I bought myself a new phone.
Is this your jacket?
Your car is parked outside.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something associated with the listener.
back_cards.example_en: I like your new hairstyle.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in general or impersonal statements.
back_cards.example_en: Your health is important.
Your idea sounds really good.
